channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Grenfell risk assessor reckless over cladding, inquiry hears
item.description: An expert witness criticises the decision to sign off the tower's cladding as safe without evidence.

item.title: 'Predatory paedophile' headteacher jailed for abuse
item.description: Duggie Speight sexually abused a 15-year-old boy and filmed youngsters at a swimming baths.

item.title: Bomb squad called as man held by terror officers in Basingstoke
item.description: Specialist officers search a property in Basingstoke as a man is held by counter-terrorism officers.

item.title: Autistic boy knocked unconscious by fellow students
item.description: Jeremiah required hospital treatment after being attacked on his way home from school.

item.title: Plea to religious leaders follows fiancé's suicide
item.description: The partner of a gay man from a religious family who killed himself is trying to spark change.

item.title: WW2 pilot has 100th birthday flight over Shropshire
item.description: John Trotman, twice awarded the Distinguished Flying Cross, has got behind the controls once more.

item.title: PC borrows bike to catch suspect in Birmingham park
item.description: Bodycam footage captures the not-so-high-speed chase across the park in Birmingham.

item.title: Rail industry urges workers not to spurn the train
item.description: City centres and High Streets could suffer unless workers start taking the train again, the industry warns.

item.title: Cawston Park: Vulnerable patient deaths prompt hospitals warning
item.description: A series of failings was found in the care offered to three adults with learning disabilities.

item.title: Tom Cruise in Lake District for Mission: Impossible filming
item.description: The Hollywood star chatted with fans after completing four parachute jumps for Mission: Impossible.

item.title: Luton killer stabbed uncle to death before pub session
item.description: Steven Arnold stole his uncle's bank card to go out drinking after killing him with a kitchen knife.

item.title: Bristol petrol station siege: Man arrested and another injured
item.description: Staff are seen fleeing to a safe room and loud bangs are heard in the stand-off in Bristol.

item.title: London transport staff warned of anti-mask posters with razor blades
item.description: The Rail, Maritime and Transport (RMT) union says its members are at risk.

item.title: Harborne grandad's cancer op cancelled four times
item.description: Noel Brown, from Birmingham, said he had been left distressed by the repeated cancellations.

item.title: Racist fan's Facebook post 'harassed' West Brom player
item.description: A court rejects autocorrect as the excuse for the message about West Bromwich Albion's Romaine Sawyers.

item.title: Rio Ferdinand: 'I have to explain the monkey emoji to my kids'
item.description: Former England footballer Rio Ferdinand tells MPs about his experience of online hate and racism.

item.title: Blackpool sailor gets medal for LGBT maritime diversity work
item.description: Paul Owen is the first recipient of the Merchant Navy Medal for LGBT+ work in the maritime sector.

item.title: The rapper giving away school uniforms to kids on free school meals
item.description: Inspired by Marcus Rashford, Jords has donated over 100 blazers to children on free school meals.

item.title: Leicestershire sisters on track for Olympic glory
item.description: Indienne and Shaikira have both recently been crowned national champions.

item.title: 9/11: 'All we could see was smoke in the distance'
item.description: A couple reflect on how close they came to being caught up in the devastation of the 9/11 attacks.

item.title: Jason Longhurst: Manhunt for York rapist absent from trial
item.description: Police attempt to trace Jason Longhurst, who failed to appear at his trial and sentencing hearing.

item.title: Refuelling driver hit by own car at petrol station dies
item.description: Police say the driver was struck by the vehicle as it rolled away from the pump in Broughton Astley.

item.title: Kidderminster factory fire: Residents return but schools stay shut
item.description: Some residents return home following evacuations due to gas canisters at the metal works.

item.title: Blackpool hotel needs planning permission for asylum seekers
item.description: Plans to house 324 asylum seekers at the Metropole Hotel in Blackpool have been criticised.

item.title: Kidnapper dubbed 'every woman's nightmare' jailed
item.description: Omar Alam is described by a judge who jailed him for life as "every woman's living nightmare".

item.title: Football memorabilia collection sells for almost £400,000
item.description: The collection of medals and shirts, amassed over six decades, was expected to fetch £170,000.

item.title: Richard Dunn: Boxer's family sent rare fight footage after appeal
item.description: Richard Dunn's relatives are able to replay his European title victory after rare footage is found.

item.title: Brilliant Raducanu reaches US Open final on debut
item.description: British teenager Emma Raducanu reaches the US Open final as her meteoric rise continues with a stunning straight-set win over Greece's Maria Sakkari.

item.title: England win thriller to take women's T20 series against New Zealand
item.description: England win the decisive final match against New Zealand by four wickets with one ball to spare at Taunton, to win the women's Twenty20 international series 2-1.

item.title: Slavia Prague 0-4 Arsenal (0-7 on agg.): Miedema stars as Gunners reach group stage
item.description: Vivianne Miedema makes it to 100 Arsenal goals with a hat-trick as the Gunners blitz Slavia Prague 4-0 to reach the Champions League group stage.

item.title: David Haye: 'Boxing is evolving' as he prepares for comeback aged 40
item.description: David Haye believes "boxing is evolving" for the better as he prepares to make his comeback aged 40.

item.title: 'Anything is possible' - Bjergfelt makes history as Tour of Britain's first para-cyclist
item.description: William Bjergfelt is out to inspire others after becoming the first para-cyclist to race in the Tour of Britain.
